com.milk.util
Class FlatTable

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.util.FlatTable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Table
public class FlatTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements Table

This is an implementation of a Table as a flat array. No hashing, linear search, etc. It's generally useful for small tables, but performace will no doubt be unacceptable for big tables.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Constructor Detail

FlatTable

public FlatTable()
Construct an initially-empty FlatTable. The key and value predicates are, by default, both TruePredicate.TheOne, and the key comparator is, by default, EqComparator.TheOne.

Method Detail

setKeyPredicate

public void setKeyPredicate(ObjectPredicate pred)
Set the key predicate for this table. Note that this will not cause keys already in the table to be suddenly, mysteriously rejected. Beware of changing the predicate in an already-populated table.

Parameters:
pred - the new predicate

setValuePredicate

public void setValuePredicate(ObjectPredicate pred)
Set the value predicate for this table. Note that this will not cause values already in the table to be suddenly, mysteriously rejected. Beware of changing the predicate in an already-populated table.

Parameters:
pred - the new predicate

setKeyComparator

public void setKeyComparator(Comparator comp)
Set the key comparator for this table. Note that will not cause elements already in the table whose keys suddenly become considered equal to be suddenly, mysteriously merged. Beware of changing the comparator in an already-populated table.

Parameters:
comp - the new comparator

setCapacity

public void setCapacity(int capacity)
Set the capacity of the table to be at least the given number of elements. If the table already has more than that, then this does nothing.

Parameters:
capacity - the target capacity

getKeyPredicate

public ObjectPredicate getKeyPredicate()
Return the predicate which is used to test keys for validity.

Specified by:
getKeyPredicate in interface Table
Returns:
the key predicate

getValuePredicate

public ObjectPredicate getValuePredicate()
Return the predicate which is used to test values for validity. If the value predicate returns true for a particular object, then it is okay to use that object as a value in this table.

Specified by:

Returns:
the key predicate

public TableElement getElement(java.lang.Object key)

Specified by:

Parameters:

Returns:

public java.util.Enumeration elements()
Get an Enumeration of all the elements of the table. The enumeration consists only of TableElement objects.

put

public boolean put(java.lang.Object key,
                   java.lang.Object value)
Map a key to a value. If the key already mapped to a value, then replace that mapping.

Specified by:
put in interface Table
Parameters:
key - the key
value - the value
Returns:
true if the key was found and replaced, false if the operation put a new binding in the table

remove

public boolean remove(java.lang.Object key)
Remove a key (and associated value) from the table. If the key wasn't in the table, this doesn't affect the table.

Specified by:
remove in interface Table
Parameters:
key - the key to remove
Returns:
true if the key was found and removed, false if the key wasn't in the table

the index of the key, or -1 if it wasn't found
